result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaac John Rayfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to 14CF290 and 14CF335.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF290 & 14CF335

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF281.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF281.

-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF281 and 15CV311:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail. Case called at 11:18 a.m. Court reviewed files and revocation summaries in 14CF290 and 14CF335. ADA Minser recites sentencing recommendations. Joint recommendation. Atty Chapman gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement. Written explanation of sentencing given to defendant. ADA Minser addresses 15CV311. Requesting to set for another date. Atty Chapman will not be representing defendant on the CV matter. Ct orders:

  8 years total confinement
  4 years initial confinement, 4 years ES.  Concurrent to revocation sentence in 14CF290 and 14CF335
- Credit for 132 days
- DE eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs
- DNA Sample and Surcharge 
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
Sentencing hearing at 10-27-2015 11:00 am
filed by ADA Edward Minser. km
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF281 and 15CF282:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson and Atty Daniel Chapman DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared. DF: Isaac Rayfield in custody. Case called at 2:12 p.m. Motion was filed by Atty Harrelson regarding statements. Atty Harrelson is requesting to withdraw motion and there is a resolution. Defendant will be finished with treatment in November. Atty Chapman states there is no pending motions, will do plea today  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 10-27-2015 11:15 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail. Case called at 2:16 p.m. ADA Minser gives recommendation which is a joint recommendation. Orally amend Count 1 Possession with intent to deliver Class E Felony without repeater.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 in 15CF281. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Possess with intent Class E Felony without Repeater in 15CF281. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 and 3 in 15CF281. Sentencing arguments. ADA Minser requesting more time to review file. Was not prepared for plea today. Set for sentencing

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Motion hearing at 10-12-2015 02:00 pm

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF282 and 15CF281:

DF: Isaac Rayfield appeared from jail. Case called at 9:13 a.m. On case 15CF281 Atty Chapman states that no offer has been extended yet. Hoping for a resolution. 15CF282 Atty Harrelson states defendant is trying to get into a treatment facility and may need a bond review hearing in the future if she can get into a facility. Defendant's father is present and would be her transport. Would like a motion hearing set and will be filing motions in the next couple days. Court directs Atty Harrelson to have motions filed by the end of the week. Bond continues.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail and Allison Schoenoff appeared from jail. DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson. Case called at 9:10 a.m. ADA Hahn calls Investigator Haefner to the stand. S/T Investigator James Haefner employed with St Croix Co. Sheriff's Dept.  Direct by ADA Hahn. Identifies both defendants in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. No redirect by the state. Witness excused. ADA Hahn calls Investigator Mikla to the stand. S/T Investigator Mikla employed with the St Croix Co. Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. No redirect by the state. Witness excused. Nothing further by the state. Court finds probable cause on both cases that a felony has been committed and bind both defendant's over for trial. ADA Hahn does not have an information to file today. State's that Mr. Rayfield is on a PO Hold. Atty Chapman confirms and requests to set out 30 days. Atty Harrelson would like to request a modification for bond. Atty Chapman does not request a speedy demand.  Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Appointing Atty Chapman. km
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2015 at 09:15 am.

CO: EJL for RMW, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail. Defendant is currently on a PO hold. ADA Collins requests bond to remain in effect. Bond continues in form and amount.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David B. or his property.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Francis D. Collins & Ryan Moertel,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
